endpointAlgorithms.name: Treatment Success for Hypoglycemia Recovery
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: (PG_at_t >= 70) OR (PG_at_t - PG_nadir >= 20), where t is within 30 minutes of glucagon administration. PG_nadir is the minimum PG at the time of or within 10 minutes following glucagon administration.
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: A patient achieves treatment success if, within 30 minutes of glucagon administration, their Plasma Glucose (PG) is ≥70 mg/dL OR their PG has increased by ≥20 mg/dL from nadir.
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Treatment success is defined as either an increase in PG to ≥70 mg/dL or an increase of ≥20 mg/dL from PG nadir within 30 minutes after receiving study treatment. The nadir is defined as the minimum P

endpointAlgorithms.name: Change from Baseline in Plasma Glucose
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Not specified in the provided text.
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Secondary efficacy measures will be determined from the pharmacodynamic (PD) characterization of PG profiles, including evaluation of change from baseline PG concentrations.

derivedVariables.name: Treatment Success
derivedVariables.derivationRule: A binary variable indicating treatment success, defined as either an increase in PG to >70 mg/dL or an increase of >20 mg/dL from nadir PG, assessed at any time point within 30 minutes after administration of glucagon.
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: The baseline for the change calculation component is the PG nadir, defined as the lowest PG value reached during the insulin-induced hypoglycemia phase prior to glucagon administration.
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Within 30 minutes after administration of glucagon

derivedVariables.name: Change from Baseline in Plasma Glucose
derivedVariables.derivationRule: PG value at a given post-dose time point - PG value at baseline.
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: The PG value at the time of glucagon administration (Time 0), which corresponds to the PG nadir.
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Post-dose time points including 15, 30, 60, and 120 minutes.

derivedVariables.name: Probable symptomatic hypoglycemia
derivedVariables.derivationRule: An event is classified as 'Probable symptomatic hypoglycemia' if symptoms of hypoglycemia were present, but a PG measurement was not reported.

derivedVariables.name: Overall (or total) hypoglycemia
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Combines cases of documented hypoglycemia and probable symptomatic hypoglycemia, including severe hypoglycemia. Relative hypoglycemia is excluded. Each event is counted only once in this category.

derivedVariables.name: Elevated Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: ALT value is ≥ 3 times the Upper Limit of Normal (ULN).

derivedVariables.name: Elevated Alkaline Phosphatase (ALP)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: ALP value is ≥ 2 times the Upper Limit of Normal (ULN).

derivedVariables.name: Elevated Total Bilirubin (TBL)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: TBL value is ≥ 2 times the Upper Limit of Normal (ULN).

dosingRegimens.titrationSchedule: The infusion will be initiated at a rate of 2.0 mU/kg/min and may be increased every 15 minutes to a maximum of 4.0 mU/kg/min until the plasma glucose is <50 mg/dL.

doseModifications: If the patient’s plasma glucose (PG) does not increase to ≥70 mg/dL or by ≥20 mg/dL from the nadir PG within 15 minutes of glucagon administration, a second dose of the same glucagon will be administered.
If the patient’s PG does not increase to ≥70 mg/dL or by ≥20 mg/dL from the nadir PG within 15 minutes of the second glucagon administration, IV glucose will be administered.

If the patient’s plasma glucose (PG) does not increase to ≥70 mg/dL or by ≥20 mg/dL from the nadir PG within 15 minutes of glucagon administration, a second dose of the same glucagon will be administered.
If the patient’s PG does not increase to ≥70 mg/dL or by ≥20 mg/dL from the nadir PG within 15 minutes of the second glucagon administration, IV glucose will be administered.
Administered if the patient’s plasma glucose (PG) does not increase to ≥70 mg/dL or by ≥20 mg/dL from the nadir PG within 15 minutes of the second glucagon administration.
